MajorClaims.MC1: the zoo is invaluable for human beings
MajorClaims.MC2: the zoo is so useful for the earth

Claims.C1: It is very crucial for learning
Claims.C2: It helps animals out of extinction
Claims.C3: it is a interesting travel location
Claims.C4: the zoo gives humans new knowledge
Claims.C5: the zoo preserves a large number of rare animals and provides them safe habitats
Claims.C6: It benefits to a certain country
Claims.C7: the zoo not only saves animals in danger of extinction, but also helps people around the world have better lives

Premises.P1: the zoo is the important place for innate learning
Premises.P2: The zoo also let students have a chance to learning biology practically
Premises.P3: They are able to observe animals' behaviors and features
Premises.P4: practical learning help students relax from a boring lecture class
Premises.P5: researchers need the zoo to pick up some examples of animals for their researches
Premises.P6: it has diverse species of animals
Premises.P7: In the zoo, there is not so harmful as a forest
Premises.P8: They, fed by zookeepers, do not need to find food themselves
Premises.P9: we can do artificial insemenation to maintain nearly extinct wildlife
Premises.P10: because of all weird, acute, and beautiful animals in the zoo, it can be a great tourist attraction
Premises.P11: There are a lot of tourists who seek to see those animals closely
Premises.P12: If the zoo has a large number of both national and foreign tourists, it will receive a great deal of money
Premises.P13: That also make money flow, and then economics become better
